intro: Inodes rosei, commonly known as the roseleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are often lobed or serrated, and it produces small, clustered yellow flowers. Its stems are typically erect and can grow up to several feet tall. Inodes rosei is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
